Dorcas is fifty-five years old and married with two children. She runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for ten years earning a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be her third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use it for purchasing stock of sugar, flour, and rice. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and increase her business stock. 

Her hopes are to uplift the living standards of her family and be a wholesaler in the future when the business grows.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, flour, and rice for her business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 23 years old. She runs a butcher shop. She also sells poultry products on the same premises. She has one employee and has been in the business for three years.

She hopes to open another outlet in another location. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented because she has been trained in business management. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more meat.

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a 31-year-old businessman.  He is married to Judy who is employed as a secretary in a health clinic. They are blessed with one child who is five years old.  

Justin has been selling secondhand clothing for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET by a staff member.  Justin will use the loan to buy secondhand clothing to stock and sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shoe shop and to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to stock and to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina leaves in Likoni, Kenya. She is a good entrepreneur and for two years she has owned her own business. She operates an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.

Today her dreams continue to grow. Her goals are to continue increasing her income so that she can expand to a wholesale shop and to be very successful.

Her market is growing and so is the amount of capital that she needs to continue providing the products her customers demand. This will be her fifth loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy food products, such as bundles of wheat flour and maize flour, as well as household items that she will promote in her business with special discounts. She wants to offer great prices to her customers so that she can earn their loyalty, and this is why she believes she will be successful in investing her Kiva loan in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is from Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old, widowed, and has four children. 

To make a living, Narcisa manufactures and sells nipa (palm) huts to local businesses and community members. She has been in this business for seven years and earns 7,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Narcisa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy nipa palm to make roofing materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa palm to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Njogu

texts.en:
Njogu is a 50-year-old business man, who is married to Felista, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been a tailor for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES. 20,000, which he uses to support his family.  

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Njogu will use the loan to purchase clothing materials for his business.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a beauty salon for his wife and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for his tailor business.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 33 years old.  He is married and has three children.  

He provides garbage collection services to earn a living.  He employs six people.  He has been in this business for 10 years and previously acquired a loan, which helped him expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to buy garbage bins and rakes.

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save money and has received training on financial management principles.  He aspires to become an international businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy garbage bins and rakes.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a 54-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of three children, one of whom is 14 years old and the other two of whom are adults. She has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past 17 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Scholastica is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, Scholastica will educate her children. Her hope is to export her farm products, which will help her improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en:
Hameedan has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s furniture showroom. With the loan, he will put a larger variety of furniture in his showroom, which will help him make more sales and earn more income. He has been operating his business for many years and Hameedan is confident about his business success after investing the loan.

Hameedan also works and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She learned this art before her marriage and now she makes full use of her skills to earn additional income for her family. She has given birth to six children, three of whom work while others stay at home.

Hameedan never complains about her poor financial conditions and works very hard to improve her family’s situation with her efforts. She is confident about her family’s bright future.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Hameedan.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her husband's furniture selling business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old business lady. She is married to David who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children who are 16, 14, and 9 years old. Mary has been a tailor for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Mary is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to purchase cloth materials. 

With the anticipated profits from her business she will educate her children. Her hope is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a retail shop and has been operating it for two years. She describes her business as good, with reliable customers.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to open another outlet in the near future and to own land in five years. She needs a loan of 15,000 KES to buy more utensils.

loans.use: To buy more utensils.

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en: Nhu is requesting a new loan to purchase good-quality ingredients, rice, and meat to make good food, which she sells. Nhu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in growing her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can raise her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase better quality food to sell.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en: Muzaffar is a hardworking and tenderhearted men. He is married and raising two minor children. His wife is a housewife. Muzaffar always tries to improve his living conditions and for this he works harder day by day. He works at Tajik Company. He wants to live in good living conditions and for this reason he requested a loan of 8,000 TJS to purchase building materials for repairing his house. Muzaffar is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Zuvaida

texts.en:
Zuvaida is a woman who likes to work hard, that’s why she is always searching for new deals and work. She is a lovely mother and wife in her family. Zuvaida must to try to create comfort for her children. Already 16 years now Zuvaida has been busy with trading of industrial goods. She sells boots and clothing for children in the central market. Her business is developing year by year, she has her own customer base.

Zuvaida’s husband and children help her with business. With the profit she wants to pay for her son’s study. Zuvaida would like to get a loan in the size of 8000 TJS for the purchasing of seasonal shoes in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in order to expand the business

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.en: Ismatullo is a hardworking and a good family man. For five years he has engaged in cultivation of agricultural products and livestock. He has extensive experience in the business. Waste of crops goes for fodder for cattle and he keeps his cattle with this crops. His wife helps him in the business. Ismatullo would like to get a loan for purchasing four cattle for fattening and resale. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.en:
Ikhtiyor has a wonderful ability to raise different kind of vegetables. He has been busy with this kind of business for more than three years. If you faced Ikhtiyor’s field, you would be surprised to see yellow wheat, red tomatoes, sweet watermelons and apatite onions. 

He is married to a lovely woman and has six children. His wife, Iqbol, helps him with business. They sell vegetables to the local people. Ikhtiyor wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for the new season. For this purpose, he has requested a loan in the size of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS).

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es: Don Delfin, tiene 63 años de edad, está casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive junto con ellos en una aldea rural de la ciudad de Siguatepeque. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura con la siembra de maíz y frijoles, pero hace 5 años también cultiva café porque deja mayor ganancia. El café lo vende en pergamino y lavado en el mercado local. Esta solicitando 4,500.00 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo de café. Con la tierra abonada no perderá la producción y espera buenas cosechas. Uno de los desafíos que se le presentan es el corte de café ya que la mano de obra es cara y escasa, por eso va continuar trabajando con financiamientos para salir adelante. En un futuro quiere comprar una manzana de terreno más para cultivar con sus hijos y enseñarles a trabajar en negocio propio.
texts.en:
Don Delfin is 63 years old, married, and has six children. They live together in a rural neighborhood in the city of Siguatepeque.

Don Delfin has been in agriculture for many years, growing corn and beans. However, for the last five years, he has also cultivated coffee because it produces more revenue. The coffee is sold in parchment and washed at the local market.

He is requesting a loan of 4,500 HNL in order to buy fertilizers and compost for his coffee crop. The compost will be added to the land so that it will stay productive and yield a good harvest. One of Delfin's challenges is being able to prune his coffee plants since labor is expensive and in short supply. For this reason, he continues to work with the loans in order to move forward. In the future, he wants to buy another plot of land that he can cultivate with his children so that he can teach them how to work in this type of business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien would like to take a further loan to buy cosmetic and hair care products to meet the demands of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and growing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hair care and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and improving sales, and will also help her to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic goods (snack foods and beverages) to stock her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a thirty-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children aged fifteen and twelve. She has been selling fruit for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy fresh fruit to sell. She will also buy a handcart to store the fruit while she sells around the town. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a general shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell and a handcart.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a married woman with five children who are between ten and nine months old. She lives in the city of Mombasa where she works selling cereals to support her family. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her cereals business. She plans to use this loan to buy wheat flour and sacks of rice at a much better price than usual as with the Kiva loan she will be able to buy wholesale. This will make the investment successful and this will mean that she can be more competitive when she sells the products, and will earn more than the previous time.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a forty-eight-year-old married man, the father of four children. For twenty years, he has worked as a blacksmith. In 2007 Abdallah opened his present workshop. He is well known in the region with his good reputation, and the quality of work he produces.

Abdallah applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary machines for his business, such as an air compressor and a mobile iron welding machine.

Abdallah is experiencing Al Majmoua loans for the first time. He hopes that the future loans will help in expanding the business more and more.

loans.use: To buy necessary machines for his business.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Luong is requesting a new loan to buy rice, food and cooking appliances to expand his business of selling food. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying rice, food and cooking appliances.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to boost her tailoring business. She specializes in trouser suits, school uniforms and dresses. With this business Veronica is able to sustain her family and she has high expectations for growing this business since she works hard every day. This is why she is requesting another Kiva loan to expand her business. She believes she can succeed due to the high demand, her strength in her performance, and work discipline. With the loan, she wants to purchase fabric and sewing threads. All of these qualities will help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing threads.

loans.name: Lucia De Jesus

texts.es:
Lucia, está solicitando un préstamo porque está sembrando nuevamente sus cultivos, para esto deberá comprarse semilla, abono, herbicidas, este será un aporte importante para realizar la siembra, también se comprara ropa nueva para salir a vender.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, fue positivo que le ayudo a realizar una buena inversión, su condición económica familiar es mas favorable.
texts.en:
Lucia is requesting a loan because she is planting a new set of crops. For this reason, she needs to buy seeds, compost, and herbicides since these are important necessities for planting. She will also buy new clothes to sell.

The effect of her previous was positive and resulted in a good investment. Her family's financial condition is more favorable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and herbicides, as well as new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married and has four children. Elvie is thirty-four years old, and resides at Tabuan, Tukuran: Philippines. Elvie owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been twelve years in this business and earns PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. In 2010, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elvie wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is a married woman with three children. She is twenty-nine years old and resides at Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Conchita used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Her business grew and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even further.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is forty-five years old. Margarita is married and has four children. To make a living, Margarita owns and operates a service-based business. Margarita has been in her business for seven years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Margarita joined GDMPC. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is sixty-four years old. Rosita is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Rosita runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Rosita has been in her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Khairiniso

texts.en: Khairiniso is one hard-working woman. As she lives in an agricultural region, Khairiniso is busy with collective farming. She has presidential land and raises different kinds of vegetables. Many people like to eat the tomatoes, onions, potatoes, peas, and watermelon that have been raised by her. Khairiniso has a big family. Her husband, Nazar, is a collective farmer and helps Khairiniso. They try together to comfort their three children. Her aim is to buy seeds for the new season.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the new season.

loans.name: Henri

texts.fr: Marié à un certain Noellie et père de quatre enfants, Henri est âgé de 59 ans. Henri vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Henri a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Henri subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Henri a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Henri fait de la transformation de noix de palme depuis vingt cinq ans. C’est la première fois que Henri sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Henri, age 59, is married to a woman named Noellie and the couple have four children. He lives with his wife and children, and he has two other dependent children in addition to his own. Henri attended secondary school. He and his wife provide for the household needs together.

To that end, Henri has been processing palm nuts for 25 years. This is his first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster his activity and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy inputs intended to bolster the yield of his palm trees.

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.en: Rajabmurod lives and works in Tajikistan. He owns a business of selling men’s clothing at the local market. His vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise which is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Rajabmurod stay afloat with his business for 10 years. Rajabmurod has a friendly family, his loving wife supports him in his ideas and his obedient son helps him in his business Rajabmurod decided to go into this line of business because competition is lacking. He feels comfortable selling this type of inventory. Rajabmurod believes an increase in assorted merchandise will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of his business. Rajabmurod is requesting a loan of $1000 USD for purchasing of sports clothing such as trousers and t-shirts in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase men’s sportswear

loans.name: Faalo

texts.en:
Faalo is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. 

Faalo has requested a loan to buy manure chemical, a spade, a bush knife and barbed wire. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Faalo hopes to start a good plantation to help her family as well as the kids education.

loans.use: to buy manure chemical, a spade, a bush knife and barbed wire.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta is a twenty-five-year-old single woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. 

Imeleta has requested a loan in order to purchase a wheelbarrow, a bush knife, gloves, tarpaulin and gromozome chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Imeleta hopes to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a bush knife, gloves, tarpaulin and gromozome chemicals.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a thirty-one-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Penina  has requested a loan to purchase a knife, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Penina hopes to help her family for immediate events as well as provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a knife, a wheelbarrow and chemicals.

loans.name: Lepeka

texts.en:
Lepeka is a forty-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Lepeka has requested a loan to purchase barbed wire, fertilizer and a bush knife. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Lepeka hopes to help her children's education and improve and extend the business.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire, fertilizer and a bush knife.

loans.name: Iulai

texts.en:
Iulai is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Iulai has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, nails, a hammer, manure chemical, a rake and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Iulai hopes to extend her home building.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, nails, a hammer, manure chemical, a rake and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Missimide 10 Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE 10 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans. Marie est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Sourou. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Marie, pour subvenir à ses besoins, vend depuis près d’une vingtaine d’année des boules de pâte de maïs. De façon secondaire, Marie vend du maïs et du haricot à son domicile. Marie s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Marie désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Marie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE 10. Les deux crédits consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Missimide 10 is a group of three people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 52 years old. She is married to a mechanic called Sourou. The couple has seven children, who are all educated; four remain in their care. In order to provide for her needs, Marie has been sellling balls of corn dough for the past 20 years. As a secondary activity she sells corn and beans from her home. Marie gets her supplies in her region. With a view to expanding her business and in order to be more competitive on the market, she wants to boost her stock; this will enable her to increase her turnover and her income. For this reason, Marie is requesting a third loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the Missimide 10 group. The two loans they have already had have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and beans.

loans.name: Fredis Saul

texts.es:
Fredis tiene 46 años de edad, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Yorito, Yoro, junto con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
Don Fredis tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de zapatos para hombre, sandalias y zapato escolar. A este negocio ha involucrado a su familia quienes le ayudan con la producción. Sus clientes son de la misma comunidad. El actualmente necesita abastecerse de materiales e insumos para elaborar los zapatos y solicita un préstamo por 6,000.00 Lempiras para comprar cuero, suela, pegamento, hilos, forros y otros. Con esta inversión va poder seguir elaborando zapatos y mantener estable el negocio y su clientela. Su plan es crecer en el negocio y poder abarcar la mayor parte del mercado con su producto.
texts.en:
Fredis is 46 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Yorito, Yoro, with his wife and two daughters.

Don Fredis has spent the past five years manufacturing men's shoes, sandals, and school shoes. This business involves his family since they also help with the production. His customers are from the same community. Fredis currently needs to restock with materials and supplies for making shoes.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL in order to buy leather, soles, glue, thread, lining, and other supplies. With this investment, he can continue manufacturing shoes and maintain a stable business and clientele. His goal is to grow his business so that he can saturate most of the market with his product.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles, glue, thread, lining, and other supplies for making shoes.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is thirty-four years old. She is married with six children. She runs a cereals business; she has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly income of nineteen thousands eight hundred shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd., and  she plans to use it to purchase a stock of beans, maize and peas to sell. She plans to use the profit to purchase stock and improve the business in future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beans, maize and peas to sell.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is fifty-two years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a handicraft worker. Ly runs a shop selling fishing tools. 

She started her business six years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different fishing tool sets to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different fishing tool sets to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, fifty-eight, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a driver, and is a mother to their child. By the grace of God, Mary Ann has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Rosita oversees operations of their Side Car transportation business. They have one unit of side car or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community, all of which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Rosita’s husband also drives one of the side cars when he has free time. She also sells vegetables products and has a bed space rental in her house for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her side car and also to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell and to renovate the room that she rents. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Rosita dreams to be able to buy another side car soon and for her house to be renovated. She also dreams that her child will finish his education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her sidecar, room rentals and additional stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, forty-one, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanical worker.

Trang has been selling sweetened porridge for six years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality ingredients and beans to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy better quality ingredients and beans to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Thong, thirty-seven, is married and has two sons. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife make money by sewing clothes at their house.  

He started this business ten years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of materials to increase his production of clothes and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of materials to increase his production of clothes.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is forty years old, and is married with three children, one son and two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a store selling hand made pottery in front of her door for twelve years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her two children.

Hanh is requesting a loan to buy more pottery products so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of pottery products to sell.

loans.name: Zakran's Group

texts.en:
An efficient lady who performs her duties very well, Zakran is a housewife married to an animal-seller. He purchases goats and sheep to raise and then sell to butchers for profit. Zakran provides full support to his business, feeding the animals and keeping their living space clean. Her three sons have their own animal-selling businesses.

Zakran is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband to buy sheep and goats in larger numbers to further expand his business. He is very experienced, and she is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy animals for her husband's animal-selling business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old.  She is married and has one child. 

Josephine runs cereals business.  She has been in this business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of 7,800 KES.  She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of beans and maize.  She plans to use the profit to add additional stock of assorted cereals and to provide for her family’s basic needs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of beans and maize.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her businesses. She operates a business from her home: buying and selling goats to butcher shop operators. She started working as a merchant five years ago. As she wants to continually improve her businesses, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her businesses' turnover increases, such as the middle of the year. This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her second financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy goats for resale and purchase iron sheets to roof her family house which is under construction.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en:
Hassana is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of one child. She is the only person responsible for caring for her child. Hassana is a hard working woman, well known in the region, and has a good reputation for working hard. Hassana has 21 years of experience in tailoring. In 2005 she officially started her own tailoring business.

Hassana used to clean houses to support herself and her child, but because she has a problem with her right leg, she decided to find a less tiring business. She opened a convenience store, and started tailoring. Both businesses are located in her house, and this is very helpful for her in many ways.

Hassana applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to support her businesses with the necessary tools and products such as buttons, zippers and threads. She will also use a portion of the loan to purchase necessary products for her convenience store to get ready for customers' special requests for Holy Ramadan.

loans.use: To purchase buttons, zippers, and threads, as well as products for her convenience store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 60 años, es una mujer honesta, humilde y muy trabajadora. Madre de tres hijos, a quienes ama mucho. Vive sola en su casa propia, y día a día lucha por seguir adelante y tener una vida tranquila.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Compra sus productos, al por mayor, ya sean en paquetes, en sacos o por cajas de manera semanal o quincenal y luego los distribuye en su tienda. Siempre tiene un trato agradable, regalando siempre una sonrisa y los mejores precios para conservar su clientela. Su tienda está instalada en un área de su terreno y lleva en este trabajo cerca de 2 años. Desde que empezó no ha tenido ningún problema que le haya impedido continuar. Antiguamente se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de madera, pero por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar su trabajo y ahora está más contenta por haber tomado esa decisión. Ahora trabaja con mayor comodidad y se siente tranquila porque puede generar ingresos para su familia.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la satisfacción que siente al ver a sus clientes que regresan contentos de haber encontrado en su bodega todo lo necesario. Además este negocio le ha dado independencia y sobre todo solvencia económica para solventar los gastos de la educación, alimentación y salud de su familia. Espera poder ampliar su tienda, implementarla con mayor diversidad de productos y mantener la clientela que ha logrado conseguir hasta el momento.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará mayor cantidad de comestibles de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, verduras, tubérculos y granos.
texts.en:
Isabel, 60, is a hardworking, honest and unassuming woman.  She is the mother of 3 children whom she loves very much.  She lives alone in her own house, and she struggles daily to keep going and to have a tranquil life.  

She has a business selling groceries and other basic necessities.  She buys her products at wholesale in bundles, sacks or boxes on a weekly or bi-weekly basis, and she later distributes them in her store.  She always provides friendly service with a smile, and offers the best prices to keep her customers.  Her store is set up in a space on her land, and she has been doing this work for about 2 years.  Ever since she started she's not had any problem that has prevented her from continuing.  She used to prepare and sell wood, but because of health reasons she left that line of work and now she feels content for having made this decision.  She now works in greater comfort and feels tranquil because she can generate income for her family.

What she likes about her work is the satisfaction that she feels when she sees her returning customers content with having found everything they needed in her store.  Also, this store has given her independence, and most of all, financial solvency to cover the food, health and educational expenses of her family.  She hopes to be able to expand her store, filling it with a greater variety of products so that she can keep the customers that she has managed to attract thus far.  

This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity and the trust that is being placed in her.  Also, she pledges to make her payments in a punctual manner.  She appreciates being part of her communal bank, because she has seen that the members are responsible and supportive of each other.  With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy a greater quantity of consumer staples, such as: rice, sugar, vegetables, tubers, and grains.

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a variety of basic goods including sugar, confectionery and household necessities.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a further loan to buy more electrical equipment to sell from his store. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy old DVD players, speakers, and televisions to repair and sell.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a widow and has seven children all of whom graduated from school. She resides in her own house with no access to electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for the family. For the past four years, Mnyazi has operated a retail shop selling business. She also generates additional income by working as a part-timer in a sisal estate as a casual labourer. 

Mnyazi has applied for a loan of 50,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. Mnyazi sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from Likoni town to her shop. Mnyazi hope to see her business expand to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Buoi

texts.en:
Buoi, fifty-seven, is married and has four daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an electrician. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business five years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 39, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a saleman. Ngoc supports her family by running a general store and a shop to make garments at her house, which she has done for ten years. 

Ngoc is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of basic products for her store and sewing materials to increase her production of garments and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of basic products for her general store and sewing materials to increase her production of clothing.

loans.name: Luom

texts.en:
Luom is 49 years old and is married with three children, two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a driver for hire. Luom has been running a food stall selling pork and noodles for 19 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Luom is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more kinds of food and better quality ingredients and meat to make good foods for selling. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of food and better quality ingredients and meat to make good foods for sale.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi works at two activities. On the one hand she sells fish from her fish pond and on the other she does farming activities. She learned both activities empirically two years ago and it is since 2011 that she started to use them to earn income.

Her clientele are neighbors, friends, family members and people referred by current customers. The sale of fish takes place at the market and nearby her place of operation and she is able to monitor both business.
 
Her goal is to become a major supplier of fish and to expand her profit margin, investing to attract more customers, but her working capital is her greatest challenge to reaching this dream. This is the reason why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, a financing from Kiva through Yehu Microfinance Trust, that she’ll use to buy a water pump for pumping water from her borehole to her fish pond.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is thirty-three years old and married with three children. He hawks household items, and he has been in this business for eight years with good income.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it for purchasing more stock of thermos flasks, plates, mugs and glasses. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. 


He hopes to set up a household goods retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more thermos flasks, plates, mugs and glasses for sale.

loans.name: Raad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has five children.

Raad owns a shop for installing mirrors and glass. He has been working in this business since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.en:
Saidahmad during one year is busy with driving. Saidahmad drives in the road of Yavan to A. Jomy and from A. Jomy to Yavan. He has many customers. 

He is married. His wife works on a collective farm. They have two children. Saidahmad’s mother lives with them and helps with the upbringing of the children. Saidahmad always tries to do the best for the pleasure of his family. 

He would like to get a loan for repairing of his car. He hopes to your support and mercy.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Joe

texts.es:
Joe tiene 34 años, lleva una relación sentimental hace 5 años con Marleni, de 23 años. Tiene dos hijos de 5 y 12 años. Su casa es propia y ahí comparten, en familia, la felicidad de seguir adelante y conseguir el éxito.

Su trabajo consiste en la construcción, es albañil. Actividad que realiza de manera particular por recomendación. Él es muy detallista en su trabajo, es por eso que siempre busca dejar una obra en óptimas condiciones para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos y contentos con su labor. Se dedica a esto hace 10 años, algunas veces solo y otras veces en grupo, dependiendo de la magnitud de la obra. Alterna este trabajo con la carpintería, lo cual realiza hace 4 años, ambos le generan buenas ganancias, con los que alcanza a cubrir las necesidades básicas en su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede proponer a sus clientes formas novedosas de construcción y cuando las pone en práctica se emociona mucho al ver su trabajo culminado. Su pasión es buscar la mejorara de lo que hace y poder tener su propia empresa de construcción.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) renovará las herramientas de trabajo que usa en la construcción (la cinta métrica, paletas, frotachos, pulidores y otros).
texts.en:
Joe is 34 years old and has been in a relationship with 23-year-old Marleni for five years.  He has two children who are 5 and 12 years old.  He owns his own home and there, together with his family, he shares the happiness of making progress in life and achieving success.

Joe is in the construction trade.  He is a builder.  He does private work and works on recommendations.  He is very meticulous in his work and always looks to leave any job in tip-top condition so that his customers are satisfied and happy with the job.  In addition to this work, he also works as a carpenter.  Joe has been in this trade for four years.  Both of these businesses make him good profits which allow him to cover his family's basic needs.  What he enjoys about his work is that he is able to suggest new building styles to his customers and, when he puts them into practice, he becomes very emotional when he sees his finished work.  He is passionate about improving his work and being able to own his own building company.

This is Joe's second loan from MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support as it makes him feel more secure in making progress in his work.  He pledges, once again, to make his loan repayments on time as he did with his previous loan.  Joe is very happy to belong to his community bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive people.

Joe will use the 1,000 soles that he has requested to replace the tools that he uses in his building work (metric tape measure, trowels, plasterers hawks, polishers, etc.)

loans.use: to renew his work tools

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sicelia

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Sicelia bought maize flour, wheat flour, rice, bananas, sugar and cooking oil that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because her customers have requested more products, as they have become an established clientele, and Sicelia's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why her Kiva loan will be successful, because she will be able to stock her retail shop and purchase seedlings and pesticides for farming vegetables. Sicelia tells the lenders that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to stock her retail shop and purchase seedlings and pesticides for farming vegetables.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 69 years old, married and has one child.

Hamid owns a grocery shop. He has worked in this business since 2003. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 to install an iron fence for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to install an iron fence for the shop

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
For more than four years Tamara has had her own business. She keeps livestock and sells meat and milk products. She wants to increase her business and that why she works hard to realise her plans. 

Tamara has a big friendly family. She is married and has four children. She wants to get a loan to make repairs on their new built house. They built this house for their son as he is going to get married soon.

loans.use: To make repairs on their new built house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aitkul

texts.ru: Айткул 51 год, замужем, имеет одну дочь. Айткул работает бухгалтером в местной администрации села Тон и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес в 1992 году с суммы 2,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Айткул имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 11 овец, 1 лошадь , а также 1,08 га орошаемой земли, где она ежегодно косит клевер, служащий кормом для скота.  Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет сумму около 8,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айткул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айткул планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства, чтобы помочь дочери в приобретении квартиры.
texts.en: Aitkul is 51 years old, married and has one daughter. Aitkul works as an accountant at the local administration office of the Ton village and, to provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in breeding livestock.  After starting this business in 1992 with a sum of 2,000 som and thanks to Aitkul's hard work, today her business contains two cows, eleven sheep, one horse and also 1.08 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually gathers clover for livestock feed.  The monthly income from the business amounts to about 8,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Aitkul requested a loan in the amount of 85,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business in order to help her daughter to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Luz Aurora continua con su consultorio medico, ya son varios años que lleva con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para comprar un escritorio para su consultorio.

La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Aurora continues working in her medical clinic.  She has been in this business for a number of years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  This member is a responsible person who has a great desire to continue making progress for the sake of her family.

Luz Aurora is requesting this loan to buy a desk for her medical clinic.  She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a desk for her clinic

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of five. She has been selling fresh fruits and vegetables for the last four years making a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to add more variety of fruits and fresh vegetables and expand her work stall. 

The anticipated profits will support her expansion plan. Her future plans are to own residential houses.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia lives in Samburu with her five children aged between 1 and 18 years old. She dreams of a promising future in which she is able to provide her little one with the potential for success. Her children are the motivation behind her work selling greengrocery items, selling vegetables, fruit, onions and tomatoes. Her business is open on weekends and holidays. It is located in her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members and friends. They are familiar with the products that Rukia sells and are loyal to her business. 

Rukia's goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to help her distribute products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help her distribute products to her customers.

loans.name: Aathab

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 25 years old, married and has one child.

Aathab is a photographer and owns a studio. He established his business in 2005, therefore he has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a youth loan. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the studio and to install new shelves

loans.name: Mahsatoi

texts.ru: Махсатой трудолюбивая и добрая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет двоих детей, одну дочку, она родилась в 1994 году, а её брат родился в 1989 года. Махсатой занимается куплей –продажей скота. Она начала свой бизнес с 1992 года . А так же она работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Получает зарплату 890 сомони. Зарплата не хватает в содержании семьи. В бизнесе ей помогает муж. Скот приобретает с местного скотного рынка Янгиобод. Ранее она кредитовалась в групповом займе для  закупа  КРС, чтобы расширить свой бизнес. Она обратилась в «Имон Интернешнл» и уже 7-й цикл как она кредитуется. В настоящее время она обратилась за займом в размере 4000сомони для ремонта дома. Она намерена закупить на полученный займ блочный кирпич,  песок, цемент для фасадной штукатурки дома и для устройства кладки стен цемблока.
texts.en: Mahsatoi is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is married and raising two children: one daughter, born in 1994, and her brother, born in 1989.  Mahsatoi is involved in buying and selling of livestock.  She started her business in 1992.  She also works at the dekhan farm.  She earns a salary of 890 somoni, which is not enough to support the family.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Mahsatoi buys livestock at the local "Yangiobod" market.  She was previously part of a group loan to purchase cattle in order to expand her business.  She then came to "Imon International" and has now been obtaining loans here for the 7th cycle.  Currently, Mahsatoi is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to repair her house.  She intends to use this loan to buy block bricks, sand, cement for the facade plastering of the house, and to buy equipment for laying walls cement blocks.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de venta de artesanía, la socia hace trabajos de artesanías como cocinas de arcilla, platos entre otros trabajos, ella lo vende en forma ambulatoria y lo ofrece en el diferentes lugares donde vende artesanía, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los trabajos de artesanía como arcilla, pegamentos, pinceles y pinturas.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de carteras, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de cabinas de librería y negocio de venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Nelly is a member of this group.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  Her business is selling handicrafts such as clay stoves, dishes and other items.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in different places where handicrafts are sold.  Nelly works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and this is how she provides for her child.  Nelly's dream is to expand her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making handicrafts such as clay, adhesives, brushes and paints.

The other members of this group work selling purses, groceries, stationery and clothing.

Nelly is grateful to those who will take part in helping her to achieve her dream in this way.  She pledges to make her loan repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials for making handicrafts (clay, adhesives, brushes and paints)

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 40-year-old married woman.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and four daughters.  For two years she has run a meat shop, selling meat to people in her community.

Huong is requesting a loan in order to purchase better quality meat at competitive prices from wholesalers.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers as well as to attract new customers. 

She also hopes that, through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money to leverage against any future difficulties her family faces.

loans.use: to purchase better quality meat to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband, who is a driver for hire, and her children.

She has run a general store from her house for four years.  She sells milk, beverages, stationery and confectionery.  She intends to use her loan to buy a variety of products to sell including eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will enable her to both improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell including eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 62 years old and married to Dinah who also helps in the upkeep of the family through subsistence farming. He supports a family of ten people; they were blessed with nine children aged between 10 and 32 years. Joel runs a business buying and selling green tea leaves and has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is servicing his third loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock of green tea leaves for resale.

 The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and the remaining amount to provide for the needs of his family. His hopes and dreams are to venture into large-scale tea farming.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s rickshaw transport business. With the loan investment he will replace his rickshaw body and that will allow him to secure his business asset and provide better transport services to his passengers.

He is a very hardworking person and Kalsoom is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for him. She has three other children who remain at home. She is a great mother and takes good care of her family. She is confident about her family’s better future.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Tukei

texts.en:
Tukei is 35 years old, married and supports a family of six. For the last two years he has worked his farm, including raising sheep to sell. He earns a monthly income of 47,000 KES.

This will be Tukei’s second loan from KADET LTD. He is requesting 100,000 KES, with which he plans to buy sheep to fatten and resell later during peak season.

Tukei’s anticipated profits will be invested in his farm. His ambition is to have a happy life for both himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Sakina bought sacks of charcoal for resale. Since then, her business has expanded and she plans to purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) to use in supplying her goods to her customers. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because she has a vast area of customers to supply products to, as she has an established clientele, and Sakina's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

Her Kiva loan will be successful because she will respond to demand by buying a motorcycle for transportation for her business. Sakina tells lenders that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her goods transport.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene 67 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa  y un hijo. Él es agricultor desde muy niño, aprendió con su papá ya que ejercía la misma actividad. Debido a que en su momento solo se pensaba en trabajar la tierra y no en estudiar. Así creció don Francisco y hoy manifiesta que se siente muy feliz de ver crecer su milpa. 

Él compra y vende en el mercado más próximo; para llegar ahí tiene que trasladarse a grandes distancias en vehiculo, luego se le presenta otra dificultad como lo es el acceso a su casa, por que debe trasladar los insumos que compra en el lomo de un caballo y por su edad ya se le dificulta ese ajetreo. 

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas y para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara. Con el préstamo tendrá la facilidad para pagar principalmente el alquiler del terreno y de esta manera garantizar el lugar donde cultivar satisfactoriamente. Además, garantizara el alimento para su familia; pues comenta que aunque sus recursos económicos son limitados, la ventaja más grande en su situación actual es tener la cosecha para su sustento diario. También, sus proyecciones a futuro es tener un terreno propio para cultivar y que su hijo continué trabajando como él lo ha hecho hasta hoy.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco, 67, is married.  He lives with his wife and son.  He learned farming from his father when he was just a boy.  At that time, working the land was considered more important than going to school.  That's the way it was for don Francisco and he says now that he is just happy to tend his crop.

He buys and sells at a local market.  He has to travel a long way by vehicle to go to and from the market and the extra distance to his house is also difficult.  He has to carry the supplies he brings on horseback, not an easy thing for a man his age.    

Don Francisco is applying to Fundacion Campo for a loan, part of which he will use to buy supplies for his farming business and part to pay rent on the land where he grows his crop.  The investment will make it easy for him to pay the rent upfront and thereby guarantee a good spot for planting.  The investment will also ensure that he can feed his family.  He tells us that though his financial resources are limited, the great advantage of his situation is that he can grow the crops he and his family need to live from day to day.  He wants to buy a farm of his own in the future so that he can grow his crops on his land and have something to leave for his son.

loans.use: to pay expenses for his farming business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills. For the past ten years she has run a grocery shop.

With her previous Yehu loan Susan bought soap, detergents, wheat flour, maize flour and beans, thus increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a 40,000 KES from Yehu because she has a growing clientele and Susan's working capital is insufficient to meet demand.

Susan plans to buy more stock for her grocery and to install a water tank from which she’ll sell fresh water. She tells the lenders that her Yehu loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may you continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery and to install a water tank from which she’ll sell fresh water.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 28 years old and married to John. Together they have one child aged three-years-old.

She sells computer games, CDs, and other related materials, a business she has been running for the last five years.

Lilian has applied for a loan to buy a generator and a P3 machine. She hopes that once she invests this loan she will get better returns and even be able her to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a P3 machine.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is married and lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. She operates a water selling stall, selling fresh water to her neighbors and passersby. 

She is focused on improving her personal life and satisfying her customers' needs. At present, she is using her Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Yehu Microfinance Trust, to start another business of buying and selling firewood. She will buy bundles of firewood for resale. She needs to purchase firewood for her business to better respond to her customers and also to be able to sell to them and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married but still doesn’t have any children.

Houssein has owned a coffee shop since 2010, offering different types beverages. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting  a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for the store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide  better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the store.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia tiene 61 años, es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y muy trabajadora. No tiene ninguna pareja hace mucho años, sin embargo tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores. Vive en su casa propia al lado del menor de sus hijos llamado Sedny. Ambos comparten el día a día de trabajo, esfuerzo y lucha por seguir adelante.

Su actividad principal es la venta de alimentos, principalmente carne de animales silvestres como venado, tapir, tortugas, majas y gallinas de chacra, lo complementa con la venta de plátanos y frutas de la región. Antiguamente criaba estas especies en su propia chacra y de ahí se abastecía, pero ahora las compra de los pobladores del campo o comunidades nativas. Realiza esta actividad hace 20 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en la ciudad se celebra alguna festividad o acontecimiento importante. Así también vende ropa usada y productos de perfumería hace 2 años, de manera eventual. Todos estos trabajos le generan buenos ingresos y le dan tranquilidad económica.
Lo que le gusta de su labor es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía al estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos.

Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará gallinas de chacra, carne de tortuga y de otros animales silvestres; también plátanos por racimos y algunas frutas.
texts.en: Adilia is 61 years old. She is a very hard-working, entrepreneurial, honest woman who has not had a partner for many years. However, she has three children who are all now adults. Adilia lives in her own home alongside her youngest son whose name is Sedny. Every day the pair both work and make efforts to make progress. Adilia's main business is selling food, mainly meat from wild animals such as deer, tapirs, turtles, paca and farmyard hens. In addition, she also sells bananas and regional fruits. In the past, she would raise these species on her own farm and thereby supply her own business with animals. Now, however, she buys them from people in the countryside and those living in indigenous communities. She has been in this business for 20 years and works extra hard when the town is celebrating a festival or important event. Adilia has also been selling used clothing and perfumes for two years on a casual basis. All of these businesses make her good income and provide her with financial peace of mind. What Adilia likes about her work is the fact that she is in contact with other people. Being physically active all the time gives her a lot of energy and vitality. Above all, she feels happy because she is able to make her own income and thereby continue covering her own expenses. This is Adilia's seventh loan from MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because it makes her feel more secure as she makes progress in her work. For this reason, she pledges once again to make her loan repayments on time as she has in the past. She is very happy to belong to her community bank because all the members of the bank are very responsible and supportive. Adilia will use the 1,500 she has requested to buy farmyard hens, turtle meat and other wild animal meat. She will also buy bananas by the bunch and some other fruit.

loans.use: to buy wild animal meat and other products to sell

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 33 años, es una mujer sencilla, muy amable y trabajadora. Está separada de su esposo, con quien tiene tres hijos de 14, 9 y 4 años. Junto a ellos, vive en la casa que construyó con su ex esposo, ahora es propietaria del terreno que más adelante será distribuido en partes iguales a cada uno de sus hijos. Por ahora, solo se esmera a diario para ofrecerles todo lo necesario. 

Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas típicas de la región, cada uno de sus refrescos son elaborados con las frutas más frescas que consigue en el mercado principal de la ciudad. Trabaja durante 12 horas al día en su puesto ubicado en una esquina muy comercial de su zona. Inicialmente vendía en la puerta de su casa, más adelante lo hizo por toda la ciudad llevando sus baldes con refresco en una carretilla, pero ahora tiene su puesto gracias a un convenio con la Municipalidad de su distrito, y ahora vende mucho más que antes gracias. Desde niña se dedica a esta actividad y ya lleva 20 años haciéndolo, ha trabajado siempre sola. Y aunque ahora le va muy bien, reconoce que al principio tuvo muchas dificultades, pues no sabia preparar muy bien los refrescos; sin embargo, ahora se ha vuelto una experta y sus deliciosas bebidas son consideradas las mejores de su sector. Está muy contenta porque la rentabilidad de este negocio le permitió realizar muchos cambios y mejoras en sus condiciones de vida. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, le agrada conversar con sus clientes y de esta forma conocer sus preferencias, gustos de sabores. Para más adelante desea tener una tienda o una fuente de soda donde pueda vender mayor variedad de refrescos y helados de frutas regionales.

Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, con cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

El monto solicitado (S/. 1500) lo invertirá en la compra de las frutas y demás ingredientes que necesita para continuar vendiendo sus refrescos. También comprará helados de frutas regionales y una congeladora pequeña de S/. 500 para conservarlos.
texts.en:
Ángela is 33. She is a modest woman; very friendly and hard-working. She is separated from her husband, with whom she has three children, ages 14, 9 and 4. She lives with them in the house she built with her ex-husband. Now she is the owner of a piece of land that someday will be divided in equal parts among her children. For now, she just does her daily best to provide them with everything they need.

Her work is selling traditional drinks of the region. Each one of her fruit drinks is made with the freshest fruit that she gets at the city's main market. She works 12 hours a day at her stand, located at a corner in her area, that has a lot of commercial activity. To begin with, she used to sell at the door of her home, but later did so all over the city, carrying her fruit drink containers in a cart. But now she has her stand, thanks to  an agreement with the municipal authority of her district, and now sells much more than before. 

She has worked at this livelihood from a young age, and now has been doing it for 20 years, always working alone. And even though now it is going very well, she acknowledges that at the beginning she had many difficulties, as she didn't know how to prepare the fruit drinks very well. However, now she has become an expert and her delicious drinks are considered the best in her part of the city. She is very happy, because the profitability of this business has allowed her to make many changes and improvements in her living conditions. She really likes what she does. She enjoys talking with her customers and that way knowing their preferences and tastes when it comes to flavors. 

This is her third loan with MFP, so she is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue toward her goals. Moreover, she is very committed to once more making her installment payments on time, as she did previously. And she is very happy about belonging to her communal bank, as all the members are good and friendly, and supportive of one another.
