Francisca's business is selling items from a general store.  She has been in this business for a month.  She says that the store is located in her own home and she works from Monday to Sunday.  Her work hours depend on her availability.

Francisca buys her merchandise from different suppliers and supermarkets at low cost which is financially convenient.  She will use her loan to buy school supplies, creams, toys, light bulbs, socks, shampoo and a variety of other items for her store.  One of her goals as regards her store is to have all kinds of items available so that she can increase her sales, gain more customers and ultimately provide her family with a better quality of life.

Francisca lives together with her husband and their 8-year-old son.  Her dream is to have a large store and a lot of customers.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she is receiving from Fondo Esperanza because it allows her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs who belong to her community bank because they share business types and interests and it keeps her occupied.

Peñalolén is located to the east of the Metropolitan region.  The area has a number of attractions such as vineyards, buildings which are considered heritage sites, and outdoor places where you can go on trips.  These elements are turning the district into a new tourist spot within the Metropolitan region.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, creams, toys, light bulbs, socks, shampoo and other items for her store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 22-year-old, youth client who is married with two children. 

Ali is a tailor for curtains. He has owned his own sewing shop since 2010. Therefore, he has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of the local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Ali is requesting $2,100 to redecorate his shop. He is aiming to increase his profit, which will afford a better life standard for the entire family.

loans.use: to pay to redecorate his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old and married with six children. He sells soft tissues. He has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use it to buy tissues and wet wipes for sale. He plans to use the profit to purchase a motorbike. 

Peter hopes to be a prosperous businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy tissues and wet wipes for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 43-year-old single woman. She has three children, ranging from 13 to 18 years old. She describes herself as a quiet woman. 

Janet operates a tailoring shop where she sells sewn clothes such as school uniforms, shirts, blouses, trousers, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a town and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Janet will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to venture into a boutique business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children with the profits she earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Alaa is 51 years old and married with five children.

Since 2009, Alaa has owned a shop where he repairs electronics. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of the local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Alaa is requesting a $3,000 loan in order renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 23-year-old man from Kisumu, situated in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Salome who is also a business lady. They have two children, ages 1 and 3.

Erick sells sugarcane molasses, especially to herdsmen. He has been doing this for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy drums in which he can store the molasses. He will use the profits to pay the school fees for his children.

Erick's dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: To buy drums in which he can store molasses.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LAS FLORES” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Sonia es la presidenta.  Librería, venta de dulces, servicio de internet, servicio de fotocopias, pensión, venta de cosméticos, venta de productos AVON, venta de frazadas.
La señora Sonia cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que ingresar invitación de una socia; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pensión), mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo de un trabajo anterior.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para equipar su negocio (compra de horno) los que comprarán de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es divorciada y tiene dos nietas a su cargo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el seguro que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS FLORES” (Flowers) community bank are starting their first loan cycle as part of the Villa Tejada regional office.  This group has eight members and Sonia is the president of the group.  The members are engaged in the following business activities: running a stationery store, selling sweet treats, providing Internet services, providing a photocopying service, selling meals, selling cosmetics, selling Avon products and selling blankets.

Sonia tells us that this is the first time she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank.  She joined through an invitation from an existing member.  Her current business is selling meals.  She has been in this business for a number of years and learned from a previous job.

Sonia will use this loan to equip her business (buying an oven).  She will buy her oven from a wholesalers and then install it in her work space.  This work enables Sonia to support her family and help get them ahead in life.  She is divorced and has two granddaughters in her care.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sonia replied that she likes the insurance that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Twongere Umusaruro /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Esdras  fait partie du groupe Twongere Umusaruro. Le nom du groupe signifie «Accroître la récolte ou Amplifier la récolte ». Il a 48 ans, il est marie avec 8 enfants de 2 ans à 27 ans.Il a 1 personne en charge
autres que ses enfants .Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Esdras est agriculteur maïs. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 35 kgs des semences de maïs, 250 kgs des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture de maïs, il planifie d’acheter d’autres champs pour agrandir l’étendu de son agriculture et augmenter la quantité des semences. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un grand agriculteur des maïs  dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de bâtir une maison à usage résidentiel.
texts.en:
Esdras is part of the Twongere Umusaruro group, the name of which means “increase the harvest” or “expand the harvest”. He is 48 years of age, and is married with eight children aged between two and 27 years of age. In addition to his children, he also has another person under his care. He studied three years of high school.

Esdras grows corn. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use his loan to buy 35 kilos of corn seed and 250 kilos of chemical fertilizers, as well as to pay labor expenses.

To increase his corn production, Esdras plans to buy other fields to grow more produce and increase the amount of corn he sows. Over the coming years he wants to become a successful corn grower in his region, and with his profits he wants to build a house for residential use.

loans.use: To buy 35 kilos of corn seeds and 250 kilos of chemical fertilizers, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ROSALES” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Maritza es la tesorera.  Venta de repuestos, venta de mantas a pedidos, tejido de guantes y gorras, venta de jugos de naranja, costura de overoles, venta de lana de angora, tejido de guantes a máquina.
La señora Maritza cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que ingresar invitación de la promoción; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas elaborados en telar, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo de un trabajo anterior.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de lana) los que comprarán de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el área de salud.
En la fotografía acompaña en asesor de crédito quien es la persona que acompañara todo el crédito.
texts.en:
The “ROSALES” community bank are starting their second loan cycle as part of the Alto Lima regional office.  This group has eight members and their  treasurer is Maritza.  The members work selling spare parts, selling blankets to order, knitting gloves and hats, selling orange juice, sewing overalls, selling angora yarn and machine-knitting gloves.

Maritza tells us that this is the first time she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank.  She was invited to join by a loan officer.  Maritza's business is selling blankets that she makes on a loom.  She has been in this business for a number of years, having learned in a previous job.

Maritza will use this loan to increase her supplies.  She will buy yarn from wholesalers and once she has made her products she will deliver them to people who have placed orders.  This work helps her to support her family.  Maritza is single and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maritza replied that she likes the health services.

The group members are accompanied in the photo by a loan officer who is the person who distributes the loans.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 27 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO 27 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. La représentante du groupe Delphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Théophile. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Delphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis douze ans Delphine vend divers articles à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Delphine vend des boules de pâte de maïs. Delphine achète ses produits dans sa région. C’est la troisième fois que  Delphine et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 27 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO 27 is a group of three people who are all friends and live in the same village. The group’s representative is called Delphine (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 48 years of age and married to a tailor called Théophile. The couple has five children, all at school and four under their care. 

Delphine lives together with her husband and children, and the couple ensures that the different household expenses are met. For the past 12 years Delphine has sold miscellaneous articles from her home. In addition to this business, she also sells corn paste balls. She buys her products in the region where she lives. 

This is the third time that Delphine and the other members of the GBENONKPO 27 group have requested the financial support of Alidé. They have done so to increase their working capital and businesses, and to better meet the needs of their customers. Their two previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Wangninagbe 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE 6 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Akouavi Sylvie Judith, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akouavi Sylvie Judith est âgée de 39 ans et est marié à un maçon du nom de Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Sylvie Judith vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Depuis dix sept ans, Akouavi Sylvie Judith exerce comme activité, la vente d’ignames frits et des beignets de haricot. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Akouavi Sylvie Judith désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Akouavi Sylvie Judith sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE 6, un troisième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAGBE 6 group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same savings group. The representative of the group is called Akouavi Sylvie Judith, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. 

This is the third time that this group has requested the financial support of Alidé, and its members have done so to expand their businesses. Akouavi Sylvie Judith is 39 years of age, and is married to a builder called Pascal. The couple has three children, all at school and all under their care. Akouavi Sylvie Judith lives together with her husband and children, and together the couple ensures that the various household expenses are met. 

For the past 17 years Akouavi Sylvie Judith has worked selling fried yams and bean fritters. This allows her to easily meet her family’s needs. As she hopes to better meet the needs of her customers, she wants to increase her stock of produce and expand her business. To do so, Akouavi Sylvie Judith has requested a third loan from Alidé along with the other members of the WANGNINAGBE 6 group. They have successfully repaid their first two loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of yams and beans.

loans.name: Mahutin 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHUTIN 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies qui s’approvisionnent au même lieu. La représentante du groupe, Jacqueline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un guérisseur nommé Barthélémy. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Jacqueline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis dix ans, Jacqueline vend des céréales (maïs, riz) et du vin de palme, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son quartier. Jacqueline achète ses produits dans une région du Bénin. C’est la quatrième  fois que Jacqueline et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN 2 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUTIN 2 is a group of three people, the members of which are all friends and buy their supplies in the same place. The representative of the group is called Jacqueline (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 36 years of age and married to a healer called Barthélémy. The couple has four children, some of whom are at school and all under their care. 

Jacqueline lives with her husband and her children, and together the couple ensures that the various household expenses are met. Jacqueline did not go to school, and for the past ten years has sold cereals (corn and rice) and palm wine. With this business she obtains significant income in her neighborhood. She buys her products in a region of Benin.

This is the fourth time that Jacqueline and the other members of the MAHUTIN 2 group have requested the financial support of Alidé. They have done so to increase their working capital and businesses, and to better meet the needs of their customers. Their previous loans were all repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and corn and drums of palm wine.

loans.name: Arco Iris Ii Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ARCO IRIS II está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Elena , vive por la zona  de Bolívar, ella tiene 28 años y dos hijos todos ellos en edad escolar, La Sra. Elena se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante visitando casas y oficinas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elena  va a usar este préstamo para compra de cosméticos por mayor y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir ampliando su  negocio, la Sra. Elena va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una amplia gama de productos de belleza para ofertar a su clientela. La Sra. Elena es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The ARCO IRIS II community bank has eight members: seven women and one man.  The bank's president is Elena.  She lives in Bolívar district, is 28 years old, and has two school-age children.  Elena's business is selling cosmetics as an itinerant vendor, visiting houses and offices.  This loan is her first from the institution.  She will use it to buy cosmetics wholesale so that she can increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting the loan is so that she can continue expanding her business.  Elena will use the profits that she makes to continue buying merchandise and thereby improve her income.  Her wish for her business is to have a wide range of beauty products to sell to her customers.  Elena is a very hard-working person.  She feels happy for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members are receiving because, in some cases, they are supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as creams, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 48 years old and married. He has seven children. 

He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for 25 years and has one employee. Besides this, he is a farmer.  

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to make good sales because he has been trained in business management. He hopes to expand his business in five years.

He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Doudedji Group

texts.fr: DOUDEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Patricia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans. Patricia est mariée à un certain Rock. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Patricia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses  enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Patricia vend depuis une quinzaine des pommes fruits de façon ambulante. Patricia s’approvisionne dans un quartier du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Patricia sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOUDEDJI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
DOUDEDJI is a group of three people who all live in the same neighborhood of Benin. The group’s representative is called Patricia (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 31 years of age and married to a man called Rock. The couple has two children, who are at school and under their care. Patricia lives together with her husband and children, and together the couple ensures that the various household expenses are met.

To cover the household costs, Patricia has worked for about 15 years selling apples on the street. She gets her supplies from a neighborhood in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and expand her business, Patricia has asked for her first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the DOUDEDJI group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ needs and to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy apples.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Don Rafael tiene la edad de 55 años, casado,  padre de cinco hijos, de profesión soldador, con un taller en su casa, su esposa le apoya, sus hijos casados, desde hace años viene mejorando su pequeña casa, aun parte es de zinc, ahora que ya sus hijos son independiente está comenzando a construir, lo que  avanzara mas rápido con préstamo otorgado en Afodenic.
Construirá construcción de cuarto y bajarete, para trabajar en mejores condiciones en el  taller, ya tiene el inicio con el arranque con ahorros propios, materiales a comprar, bloques,  piedrín, cemento, hierro, láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Rafael is 55 years old, married, and the father of five children.  He is a welder by profession and has a workshop at home.  He has the support of his wife.  Rafael's children are all married.  For some years, he has been making improvements to his small house, part of which is still built from metal sheeting.  Now that his children are independent, he is starting some building work.  He will make progress more quickly with a loan from Afodenic. 

Rafael will build a room and a shed so that he can enjoy better conditions in his workshop.  He has already made a start on the work with his own savings.  He will now buy blocks, gravel, cement, iron, metal sheets, lumber and nails.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that he can build a concrete room and a shed

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 58 years old. She lives in a small village in the Martvili district with her family: two sons (27 and 30 years old) and two daughters-in-law. 

Her sons are workers in construction and get a service fee for the work. Nanuli and her daughters-in-law are involved in the family's agricultural business. They have three milking cows and produce cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the other part is sold on the local open market. Also, they have a plot of land where 350 nut trees are grown. The total average monthly income of the family is 850 GEL.

Nanuli requested a loan for cultivating her agricultural land. After cultivation, she plans to sow maize there. The family will work hard during spring and summer seasons and after the seasonal works are properly done, they hope to get good harvest. This will enable them to decrease dairy costs as they will make hay from the mowed grass to feed the cattle instead of buying it at a high price. Due to the above mentioned, the family will be able to get more milk and increase cheese production. As a result of this Kiva loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions. Nanuli hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate land and sow maize.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 25 years old and married. He has one child.

Salam has owned a cafeteria since 2007. He offers food and beverages. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area and the surroundings.

He applied for a $2,000 youth loan in order to purchase a fridge and chicken grill machine for his cafeteria. 

He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and chicken grill machine for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old, married and has one child.

He sells clothes and through this, he is able to provide the basic needs for his family. He has been in the business for eight years. He describes his business as competitive.

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business because he has been trained in business management. He hopes that in five years his business will stabilize.

He needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 30-year-old business lady. She is married to Bonaventure, who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. 

She has been running a cosmetic beauty shop for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 12,000 that she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET customer. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase a stock of beauty products for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beauty products for her shop.

loans.name: Bretter

texts.en:
Bretter is a 59-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 23 years to 35 years. She describes herself as a talkative woman. 

She operates a retail and grocery store where she sells items such as maize, beans, cooking fat, sugar, bread, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a town and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy vegetables and maize. 

Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her grandchildren as she is the one who take cares of them.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and maize.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 44 years old. She lives in a small village of the Khoni district with her two children. She is a widow. She had to deal with great difficulties throughout her life, but her determination to get ahead has always allowed her to overcome them and continue progressing with her family. 

Elene runs an agricultural business. She has a milking cow and produces cheese every day. Elene sells cheese on the local open market. She is busy with farming also. She has one hectare of land where she grows maize. Part of the harvested maize is used by the family and the other part is sold on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 430 GEL.

Elene requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and their living conditions will be improved

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old, married, and has one child.

He sells clothes to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years. Previously he was employed but decided to be an entrepreneur. He runs his business in a busy environment and describes his customers as good.

Previously, he acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which enabled him expand his business. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 28-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 8 years old. She describes herself as a quiet woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells ladies' clothes and men's wear. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a town and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business.

Esther has a passion for selling children's wear, and therefore she is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy children's wear. Her business goal is to run a boutique in her hometown within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy children's wear.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and married to Erick with whom she has two children who are both in college. 

She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. after she was introduced by one of our field officers. She will use the loan to purchase stock of second-hand clothes for sale.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is thirty-four years old and has two children aged six and fourteen. She runs a grocery shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years. She has already acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her grow her business.

Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business and buy a piece of land in future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a thirty-two-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from seven months to twelve years. He describes himself as an aggressive man. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate money for purchasing cows for slaughter. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more meat to sell. His business goal is to venture into a real estate business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits generated to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is twenty-eight years and single. He operates a motorcycle business and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. after he was introduced by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to diversify by buying another motorbike for the business. Later, with the profits, he will diversify into a grocery store.

He hopes to own a cab which will operate in his town.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is forty years old and has five children who are in school. She sells dried fish and small dried fish (omena) to earn a living. She has been in the business for twenty years and has one employee. She runs her business in a competitive environment.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to operate her business because she has been trained in business management. She hopes to expand her business in five years. She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy dried fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is thirty-five years old, married and has two children.

Ali is the owner of a bakery. He established his business in 1998. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2,000 to buy two new baking machines and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits which will offer a better living standard for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy two new baking machines and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is 53 years old and has one adult child.  She operates a grocery store, which she has been doing for six years.  She has one employee. She also farms to supplement her income. She used to sell clothes to earn a living.
 
Domitila is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to buy tomatoes, potatoes, watermelons, and bananas. She has been able to successfully change and manage her business since she became a client of Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business in five years.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, watermelons, and bananas.

loans.name: Alaxpacha Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ALAXPACHA” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Julia es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, tornería, confección de calzados, venta de verduras, venta de frazadas, tejido de gorras de lana, venta de animales.
La señora Julia cuenta que es el segundo ciclo que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de su aijada; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para equipar su espacio de venta (compra de muebles) los que comprarán de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el ahorro y el seguro.
En la fotografía se puede observar una señora en el fondo vestida de azul oscuro, es la hija de la señora Bertha quien acompañó a su madre al desembolso.
texts.en:
The “ALAXPACHA” community bank are starting their second loan cycle as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  The group has eight members and their president is Julia.  The members all work in different activities including running a neighborhood store, wood turning, making footwear, selling vegetables, selling blankets, knitting woolen hats and selling animals.

Julia tells us that this is her second loan cycle as a member of a Pro Mujer community bank.  She was invited to join by one of her goddaughters.  Julia's business is selling vegetables.  She has been in this business for a number of years.

Julia's current loan will be used to equip her sales location with furniture.  She will buy these items in the street markets in the city of La Paz and then install them in her sales location.  This work helps her to support her family.  Julia lives with her common-law husband and the couple have two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Julia replied that she likes the savings and the insurance.

There is a lady in the back row of the photo who is dressed in dark blue.  This lady is Bertha's daughter and she accompanied her mother to the loan disbursement meeting.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Panian

texts.en:
Panian is forty-four years old. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He has also increased his savings and is currently applying for a loan of sixty thousand Kenyan shillings.

The loan will be used to purchase another motorbike and the additional profits will be used for an acquisition of yet another motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty years old, married, and with one child. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has one employee. In addition, she supplies sugarcane to a manufacturing company so as to earn extra income.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has grown her savings because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to become a better business lady in five years. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Goza

texts.en:
Goza is a mother of two boys and three girls. She lives in the Negev. Goza managed a business activity selling clothes but dreamed of a business where she could give more and earn better. After gaining a childcare certification, Goza began working with the local authorities and opened her daycare centre. She is caring for four children and has received strong feedback and excellent evaluations. She plans on caring for more children in the upcoming year.

Goza needed this loan for renovations and equipment for her daycare centre.

Goza wants to provide for her family and ensure her children have a healthy and strong future. Goza has found her niche and looks forward to managing a successful daycare centre.

loans.use: To pay for renovations and equipment for her daycare centre.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is twenty-two years old and is from Gaza. On January 1st 2010 he opened his own mini-market, and now hopes that throughout this youth loan he will be able to buy more goods and refrigerators for ice cream and for drinks. 

He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income and thus will help him save money to get married and have his own family. His future ambition is to develop his market and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more goods and refrigerators for ice cream and for drinks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is twenty-six years old, married, and with one child. She operates a beauty salon. She has been in the business for two years. She also does farming to earn extra income. She operates her business in a busy environment with available customers. Previously, she took a loan from Faulu Kenya which has helped her to grow her business.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to open another outlet in another location in five years. She needs a loan of 35,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mahoutondji Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOUTONDJI est composé de onze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Cécile est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Cécile est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Urbain. Cécile est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé et à sa charge. Cécile vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Cécile mène comme activité, la vente de plastiques et de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) dans un marché du Bénin. Cécile s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Cécile sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MAHOUTONDJI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MAHOUTONDJI group has 11 members, who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group has requested the financial support of Alidé. They have done so to increase their business. 

The group’s representative is called Cécile, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 30 years of age and married to a builder called Urbain. Cécile is the mother of a child who is at school and under her care. She lives with her child and husband, and the household expenses are covered by the couple. 

To cover these expenses, Cécile works selling plastic items and food (rice with sauce) in a market in Benin. She gets her supplies in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, Cécile, along with the other members of the MAHOUTONDJI group, has requested her first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy seasonings, rice and plastic items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr:
Samuel est né au Rwanda et a 31 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Samuel est Eleveur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache  de race moderne.

Pour faire croitre son élevage, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour améliore son élevage. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  être un éleveur professionnel qui a beaucoup des vaches et être le vendeur du lait dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison. François est aussi salarie.
texts.en:
Samuel was born in Rwanda and is 31 years of age. He is single, and he studied six years of elementary school.

Samuel raises cattle. This is his first loan with ACB, and he plans to use the loan to buy a modern breed of cow. To expand his cattle-raising business, he plans to request other loans to improve his business. Over the coming years he would like to become a professional cattle breeder with lots of cattle, and also would like to become a milk seller in his region. With his profits, he wants to build a house. François also has a fixed salary.

loans.use: To buy a modern breed of cow.

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr:
Donatien est né au Rwanda et a 38 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfant de 8 ans à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Donatien est Eleveur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache moderne pour élevage.

Pour faire croitre son élevage, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour acheter beaucoup des vaches. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  être un meilleur éleveur dans sa région et etre le distributeur du lait dans sa region. Avec les profits, il prévoit de vendre le fumier pour les champs. Donatien est aussi salarie.
texts.en:
Donatien was born in Rwanda and is 38 years of age. He is married and has four children, aged from eight to 12 years of age, three of whom are at school. He studied six years of elementary school.


Donatien raises cattle. This is his first loan with ACB, and he plans to use the loan to buy a modern breed of cow to raise. To increase his cattle-raising business, he plans to request other loans to buy lots of cattle. Over the coming years, he would like to become a better cattle breeder in his region, and would also like to become his region’s milk distributor. He plans to use the profits to sell manure for use in the fields. Donatien also has a fixed salary.

loans.use: To buy a modern breed of cow to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an improved breed of cow.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 27 years old and married with one child. He operates a mobile repair shop and has been in the business for the past eight years. 

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. after he was introduced by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase phone spare parts for stock in his shop. 

He hopes to purchase a plot of land where he can build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase phone spare parts

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a humble man. He operates a retail store where he sells second-hand clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the price hikes of clothes. 

He will use the 30,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy a piece of land. His business goal is to be a large distributor of clothes in his home town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to use his profits in educating his children.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for his family.

loans.name: Tancara Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “TANCARA” inicia su sexto ciclo en el Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por doce integrantes donde la señora Benedicta es la tesorera.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: trenzado de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de zapatos, venta de salchipapas y frescos, venta de peluches, venta de CD y DVD’s, venta de café, venta de verduras, venta de pilas y baterías, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces.
La señora Benedicta cuenta que hace dos años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de sus compañeras; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de café y dulces, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azúcar) los que comprarán de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta la capacitación y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Tancara" is in its sixth loan cycle as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. The group consists of 12 members and Sra. Benedicta serves as the treasurer. The members have developed business activities that include making braided blankets, selling clothes, selling shoes, selling "salchipapas" (sausages and potatoes) and soft drinks, selling plush toys, selling CDs and DVDs, selling coffee, selling vegetables, selling batteries, managing a neighborhood store, and selling candy.

Sra. Benedicta joined a Communal Bank through Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from one of her group members. At the moment, she has a business of selling coffee and sweets. She learned this trade from her mother and has been working for several years. The loan she is receiving now will increase her capital for buying sugar, which will be purchased at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then used to make what she sells in her establishment. Working in this manner helps her family get ahead. Benedicta is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Benedicta said that she enjoys the training classes and the savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old and married with two children aged eight and four years. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from the business. 

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. after she was introduced by one of our field officers. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides for use on her farm. 

She hopes to improve the living standards of her family by being financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides for use on her farm.

loans.name: Pe

texts.en:
Pe is 40 years old, widowed, and an industrious mother of a single child attending a local school. She has many years of experience in managing a farming business. She plants various kinds of crops on her own farmland, located in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Her common crops are rice, beans, potatoes, maize, and vegetables. To have good crops and ensure a high production each season, Pe always hires laborers to work on farmland, take care of her crops, and harvest them as they become mature. 

Pe would like to take out a loan of 2,500,000 Riel (KHR) to pay for labor costs and rent a tractor to till the land for growing her crops. This loan will be precious capital for her to continually develop her business. She will use the income generated to save for the future growth of her business and for her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and rent a tractor to till the land for growing her crops.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 28 years old. He is married to Lilian and together they have one child aged four years. He is a barber and has been in the business for the past three years. 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. after he was introduced by one of our field officers. He will use the loan to purchase extra shaving machines for his business. 

He hopes to expand his business by opening a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more shaving machines for his business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a single woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 22 to 37. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a tea farm where she sells tea. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located within a village, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Purity describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of KES 30,000 to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to own more plantations within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will start selling cereals in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos is 43 years old and married with four children, three are single and one is married.  She has been residing with her family in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Ruos works along with her husband to manage the maintenance of the field. They primarily grow rice, followed by potatoes, beans, and maize.  She has been in this business for almost 30 years. 

Ruos would like to expand the size of farmland to increase her crop production and thereby make more income. Consequently, she is taking out a loan in the amount of KHR 4,000,000 to add to her capital to purchase an extra plot of farmland from her neighbor. Through the help of the loan and this expansion, she hopes that she will be able to obtain a satisfying and fruitful harvest in the coming season. Then she can better her living conditions and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland.

loans.name: Mohamamd

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old and married.  He is from Gaza.  He owns a shop where he sells computers and provides a play station entertainment area, which he has been doing since 2009.  He has one employee.

Mohammad is requesting a youth loan, which he will use to buy more computers and other needed accessories.  His ambition is to develop his project and improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase computers and other needed accessories.

loans.name: Kaliya

texts.ru: Калия  - участник группы «Ынтымак 22», ей 52 года. В 2000 году, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Калия начала свой бизнес в производстве национальных рукотворных ковров ("шырдак") из войлока со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Создав свою группу и наладив производство посредством совместного закупа материалов и надомного исполнения заказов, группа имеет доход от продажи своей продукции около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на закуп необходимого сырья. Доходы от кредита Калия совместно с группой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса посредством покупки машинки для пошива национальных головных уборов колпак.
texts.en: Kaliya is 52 years old and is a member of the Yntymak 22 Group. Seeking an additional source of income for her family back in 2000, Kaliya set up her business of producing national handmade felt carpets (shyrdak) with 5,000 som (KGS). Having created their own group and set up the production by means of joint efforts in material purchasing and work from home, the Group's monthly income from the sale of their products amounts to nearly 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Kaliya turned to the organization Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase necessary carpet fibers and materials. Kaliya and the Group are planning on investing the earnings from the loan into the further business expansion and purchase a sewing machine to make Kyrgyz national hats kalpak.

loans.use: to purchase materials for carpet manufacturing

loans.name: Meiyrkan

texts.ru: Мейиркан  - участник группы «Ынтымак 22», ей 49 лет. Мейиркан занимается  производством национальных рукотворных ковров ("шырдак") из войлока. Создав свою группу и наладив производство посредством совместного закупа материалов и надомного исполнения заказов, группа имеет доход от продажи своей продукции около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мейиркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на закуп необходимого сырья. Доходы от кредита Мейиркан совместно с группой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса посредством покупки машинки для пошива национальных головных уборов колпак.
texts.en: Meyirkan is 49 years old and is a member of the Yntymak 22 Group. Meyirkan is engaged in business of producing national handmade felt carpets (shyrdak). Having created their own group and set up the production by means of joint efforts in material purchasing and work from home, the Group's monthly earnings from the sale of their products amounts to nearly 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mayirkan turned to the organization Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase necessary carpet fibers and materials. Mayirkan along with the Group is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into the further business expansion and purchase a sewing machine to make Kyrgyz national hats kalpak.

loans.use: to purchase materials for carpet manufacturing

loans.name: Karelia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Karelia,  es una joven de 27 años de edad, es casada, madre de un hijo de dos años, de profesión profesional, hoy en día labora como administradora de caja y su esposo es ingeniero el cual también trabaja.
Aun no tienen casa propia, viven en casa de su mama, pero en un cuarto aparte que han venido remodelando para estar en mejores condiciones, el techo está muy viejo, lo que cambiara, comprando láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos y playbod, remodelando divisiones de cuarto. Mejora que está haciendo en menor tiempo, gracias al financiamiento en Afodenic.
texts.en:
Karelia is a young woman who is 27 years of age. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old son. Karelia is a professional who currently works as a managing cashier while her husband is also employed as an engineer. They do not own a home but currently live at her mother's house. However, there is a room that needs to be remodeled in order to have better conditions. The roof is very old and needs to be replaced.

Karelia will buy zinc sheets, wooden beams, nails, and fiberboard in order to remodel the dividers in the room. This improvement can be completed in a short amount of time, thanks to this loan from AFODENIC.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, wooden beams, nails, and fiberboard for making improvements to a room.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 23, is a married woman who has given birth to a lovely young child.  She is a local farmer living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has devoted her lifetime to this kind of business to earn a living. She plants and harvests rice and potatoes to sell to local traders in her village. She usually collects and sells her crops twice a year, so she can earn a good income to satisfy her daily living needs.

Due to high expenses for farming, Mai would like to borrow credit from HKL, a partner of Kiva, to pay for labor costs. Workers will be hired to take out all unwanted plants from her potato plantation and transplant her rice. This will help Mai to maintain her work efficiency. In the future, she hopes to grow and expand her business and make it more profitable for the family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is 55 of age. He has a life partner and eight children, four single children and four married children. He permanently lives with his family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. He has spent most his lifetime in the agricultural business. He and his wife work together in the field to support the family, planting various kinds of crops, primarily growing rice. 

Long aims to continually improve his business to earn and save more income for the future.  He is now asking for additional capital in the amount of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a plot of farmland to expand production in the coming years.  This loan will enable him to make more income from the business and change his standard of living. As he is getting older, Long hopes to provide knowledge and a high education to his children as his legacy.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand production in the coming years.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is a loving mother of four children, residing in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She operates a crop farming business to make a living. She is 49 years old and married to her husband, a local farmer who is responsible and supportive in raising the family. Sok has been a farmer for over 30 years earning profits of USD 3.00 each day on average. 

Sok wants to hire laborers to take out all unwanted plants from her potato plantation, but due to insufficient capital she is asking for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to pay for the labor costs. Also, with a potion of the loan she will buy additional potato plants to grow. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she can increase her yields and income this coming harvest season. And she will save some for the future growth of her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun is 35 years old and working very hard to pursue a better living standard. She manages a rice farming business and provides rice-milling services in a small village, Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is married and has been blessed with four single children attending school. 

Koeun plans to provide good opportunities of education to all of her children. She wants to see them earn a university degree and have well-paid jobs. Recently, Koeun’s milling machine was out of order because it is too old, so she could not run her business well and provide quick services to her customers.

To solve this matter and in order to maintain good quality service, Koeun would like to acquire additional capital of USD 1,000 to purchase a new milling machine. She hopes that she will be able to enhance her rice mill business in order to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase a new milling machine.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is a 34-year-old married woman who has been residing with her husband and three children in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, Lorn owns and manages her farm lots, planting rice to add to her spouse’s income. She has been a farmer for almost 14 years. Normally, she is able to earn approximately USD 2.00 per day from this type of business.

Lorn wants to increase her income to pay for her daily food, clothes, and allowances for her children. As of now, she is requesting a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for plowing fees. In the future, she believes that she will be able to generate a good income and make a comfortable living someday as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Miguel Ernesto

texts.es:
Miguel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que considera necesario realizar una nueva inversión, comprándose los insumos para la siembra de maíz y frijol, como el abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, que son necesarios para proteger la plantación de las plagas.
El considera que este préstamo será una nueva oportunidad para poder realizar su trabajo agrícola, comentando que el anterior tambien le ayudo para realizar el cultivo, el cual le ha permitido mantener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a new loan because he needs to make a new investment. He will buy supplies for planting corn and beans such as compost, herbicides, and pesticides. These items are needed to protect his crops from pests.

Miguel says this loan will be a new opportunity to continue his farm work. He remarks that his previous loan helped him to complete a crop cycle, which allowed him to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Chhith

texts.en:
Chhith is a resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom, where she operates a rice farming business to generate income to support her family. She is 49 years old and married with three school-aged children. Her husband shares the responsibilities by trading firewood from a cow-pulled trailer going around the commune and the marketplaces. They work hard in their businesses because they want their children to have further education and avoid the poverty due to lack of education in the future.  

Presently, Chhith is hiring some laborers to rebuild her house and make it more comfortable. But she doesn’t have enough capital to complete this construction. Chhith decided to take out a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase building materials needed for the construction. This loan will provide the family a strong and comfortable shelter. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials needed for construction.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  He sells bananas in Mombasa. He has been selling bananas for the past five years with great success. 

Samuel is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more bananas to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business and to repay his loan. He hopes to have a booming, well established business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Joséphine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Joséphine est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Joséphine exerce comme activité, la vente de bouillie de maïs. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Joséphine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Joséphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un premier crédit auprès de  ALIDé.
texts.en:
MISSIMIDE is a group of three people who live in the same district of Benin. The group’s representative is Joséphine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Joséphine, age 26, is married to a man named Gilbert. They have three dependent children who all go to school. Joséphine lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. Joséphine herself never went to school.

Joséphine has been selling maize porridge for about ten years. This has helped her to support her family fairly easily. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

Joséphine wants to replenish her stock and bolster her activity to better meet the needs of her customers. To that end, she is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group MISSIMIDE.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia Patricia casada, con dos hijos menores edad ella se desempeña como maestra de la escuela de la comunidad donde vive, ella ejerce hace mas de 15 años, que trabaja en dicho centro, Claudia tiene aspiraciones, sueños y metas como es terminar de construir y hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación, que por motivo de financiamiento no lo había podido realizar, el crédito lo está solicitando para comprar material de trabajo como: bloque, cal, arena, cemento pintura, hierro, zinc entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia is married and has two young children. She works as a teacher at the school in the community where she lives. Claudia has been employed as this school for more than 15 years. She has aspirations, dreams, and goals that include finishing the construction and making improvements to her house. Claudia would not be able to do this without financing.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for the work such as blocks, whitewash, sand, cement, paint, iron, zinc, and other items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor is a humble villager who has been living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is now 25 years old and married to a local farmer. They have been blessed with two lovely young children. Aside from her duties as a good housewife, Hor also works at her rice and potato field to assist her husband in managing their farm in order to ensure healthy crops and a high production in harvesting season. She has been doing this business since 2009 while her husband has many years of experience in this field. 

Hor is now seeking for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to purchase fertilizers and pay plowing fees. Also, she will add a potion of the loan to her savings to hire laborers to work on her two-hectare plantation on her potato crops. She believes that this loan will have a great impact in making her business more productive, which will enable her to improve her financial stability and upgrade her living status.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Fiqirete

texts.en:
Fiqirete is thirty-six-years-old, married, and has three children. Her children range from four to thirteen years, and her oldest child, her daughter, was born with cerebral palsy. Fiqirete has been in the livestock business for these past years. She owns goats and makes delicious and healthy goat cheese and says that the profit has been good so far. Yet, she spends considerable amounts of money to accommodate their daughter’s special needs. Note here that the other two children are at a very young age as well, and the middle one needs to be sent to school this coming September.

This is Fiqirete’s first time applying for a loan. She plans to add more goats to the existing ones, hoping to increase her income in order to support her family better.  She is the only moneymaker in her family of five.  People who referred her to our institution said that she is a very responsible and a hard-working person.  She never stops working, to generate income; accommodate her daughter; take care of the younger ones, the garden, the goats; and so on.

Fiqirete is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and VisionFund Albania.

loans.use: to add more goats to the existing ones.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 64-year-old businessman from Kongowea, Mombasa. He sells tomatoes wholesale, a business he has been in for the past ten years with great success.

This will be his third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more tomatoes to sell. 

He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a pick-up truck to use in his day-to-day business activities. Peter hopes to support his three grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 26-year-old married man. He has a son who is one year old. Timothy describes himself as a motivated man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for eight years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy one bale of clothes for resale. His business goal is to import clothes within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will open another clothing retail stall.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 27 years old and married to Joan; they were blessed with one child who is four years old. Robert has been running a greenhouse business (raising mushrooms) for seven years. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

He has applied for a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more mushroom seedlings for planting. With the anticipated profits from the business he plans to repay the loan and use the remaining amount to sustain his family. 


His hopes and dreams for the future are to manage his greenhouse business to attain maximum profits, and also to be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase mushroom seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Bron

texts.en:
Bron is 33 years old, a married woman who has been living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the eldest one quit studying and helps their parents in earning income. Bron works as a local farmer cultivating rice and potatoes for food and sale. However, the main source of the family’s income is generated from her husband trading firewood; he buys in bulk from his suppliers.

Bron would like to take out a loan of KHR 5,000,000 to supplement her capital to purchase a couple of cows for firewood transportation. She hopes that she will be able to make their business more viable and profitable through using the loan. With the income generated from the business, she will reinvest into the business for expansion and save some for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows for firewood transportation.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en:
Besnik is in his early thirties and married. His three children are young and range from eleven to six years old with all of them attending school. They live in a little town, which has recently grown to approximately 10,000 residents, in the eastern part of Central Albania. 

Three years ago, Besnik started a fast food restaurant in the town. He thought that it would be a good business opportunity for him and he was not wrong. The customer demand and profits have been strong. However, being the only provider for his family hasn’t been easy. Every time he has tried to put money aside, something has came up and the money was gone.

Since the demand for his services has grown rapidly, he wants to make some improvements to the restaurant to increase capacity. This is why he is requesting a KIVA loan through VisionFund Albania. Besnik has been referred to us from our clients who know him very well. They comment on his responsible character. 

He very much appreciates your help in advance.

loans.use: To make improvements to his restaurant.

loans.name: Blasio

texts.en: Blasio is a 45-year-old married man. He has nine children ranging in age from four to 22 years. He describes himself to be polite, kind and ambitious. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy competitive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating high prices of the cows he buys to butcher. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a cow. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children with the profits he will generate.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mamba Group

texts.en:
Adina, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children. Three of them go to school. She has run two businesses, fish retailer and food vendor, for ten years. She works from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start selling fresh fish door-to-door and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants this loan to buy more fish to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to pay her children's school fees. 

Adina will share this loan with her loan group "Mamba" which has a total of 16 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Catalina Saturnina

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina tiene 53 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 16 años, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, lácteos, jugos, galletas  variedad de productos según la temporada en  su puesto de venta que se encuentran en una de las zonas más concurridas de la Ciudad De El alto,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la ciudad, la Sra. Catalina va a usar este préstamo para compra de tarjetas telefónicas  de celular por mayor para vender en su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es diversificar el negocio, la Sra. Catalina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando variedad de productos para seguir surtiendo su negocio. Ya que su deseo es con el tiempo poder alquilar una tienda y surtir con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is 53 years old, single, and has two children (ages 12 and 16). She sells candy, dairy products, juices, cookies, and a variety of other products according to the season. Catalina has a vending post at one of the busiest areas in the city of El Alto. This loan is her first cycle from this city. Sra. Catalina will use the money to buy mobile phone cards in bulk that she can sell in her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can diversify her business. Sra. Catalina faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition on a daily basis, so she will utilize the benefits of this loan to continue buying a variety of products to restock her business.

In due time, her wish is to rent a shop that is stocked with a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cabbages.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be a courageous man. He operates a retail stall where he sells both clothing and chickens. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

His business is located in a competitive business environment and his primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy chickens. His business goal is to be a large supplier of chickens within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business by supplying chickens to major towns.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en: Kisa is a 39-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a small business, making rice and curry to sell in her community. She is requesting this loan to buy a bag of cement, plywood, iron roofing and carpets to improve her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Kisa will use the loan to renew her house. Kisa joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of cement, plywood, iron roofing and carpets to improve her house.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili is a 62-year-old married woman with six children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faafili has requested a loan to buy farming tools such as a wheelbarrow, a knife, and barbed wire. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. 

With her profits, Faafili hopes to save her money for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy farming tools such as a wheelbarrow, a knife and barbed wire

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is in her late forties. She is married and has three children ranging from twenty-nine to twenty-three years old. They all live in northern Albania, in a village with beautiful scenery across the coastline on the Adriatic Sea. Kristina has been in the livestock business for the past seven years. She has been making dairy products and selling animals. “The profit has been great and the clientele is growing,” she says. 
She is requesting a loan to build a stable. This would be her first loan. Kristina is an animal lover; she wants to build a place for them where they can eat, rest and sleep better. She says, “I no longer want to have my animals staying outside under weather conditions, whether cold or hot.”
Her plans are to expand her business once the stable is built, so she can fit in more animals. In order to accomplish this, she is seeking a loan from KIVA's lenders. Kristina is known as a responsible person. People in the village comment on her good nature.

loans.use: To build a stable.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 35 years old and single with two children. She runs a small business selling chips and pancakes in her community and it is her first year doing this. Maria has requested a loan to buy eggs, flour, oil, sugar and yeast. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maria will need to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, oil, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Lumanai

texts.en: Lumanai is 25 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and this is her first year doing this. Lumanai has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, garlic, onion and soy sauce. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lumanai hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, garlic, onion and soy sauce

loans.name: Omeka

texts.en:
Omeka is a 39-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Omeka has requested a loan to buy farming tools such as a wheelbarrow, a knife and others. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. 

With her profits, Omeka hopes to save her money for the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy farming tools such as a wheelbarrow, a knife and others

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en: Faavale is 49 years old and married. She would like to go into the business of growing taro plants as a way to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy the tools she needs to do this, including a wheel barrel, knife, barbed wire and tarps. She joined SPBD earlier this year and is committed to spend the profits she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed to begin taro farming.

loans.name: Fetafiaina

texts.en: Fetafiaina is 51 years old and married with 3 children. She wants a loan to help purchase new items for her chips manufacturing business.  In the future, Fetafiaina hopes to grow and stabilize her business.  She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy items to improve her business such as frying pots and cooking ovens.

loans.name: Muta

texts.en: Muta is 40 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as flour, sugar, onions, etc. She has been doing this for four years. Muta needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, onions, toilet paper, cigarettes and Vailima beer. She hopes to use her profits to save for the kids' school fees. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, onions, toilet paper, cigarettes and Vailima beer

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en: Agalelei is 30 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling Samoan cocoa in her community and has been doing this for three years. Agalelei has requested a loan to to buy a bag of cocoa and plastic cups. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Agalelei hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of cocoa and plastic cups.
